groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content:
As a former semi-pro cyclist many years ago, winter training was always awful. Poor weather, cold weather, putting an expensive bike on a cheap wind trainer or an expensive wind trainer for that matter was less than ideal. Hated beating up the bike like that. 
Fast forward 15 years and my Kicker Bike is like a dream come true. Pulled measurements off my real bike, transferred them to the Kicker and it fits, feels, and functions like a normal training ride. 
I couldn’t be happier, the Kicker Bike Wahoo app is excellent, tells you everything you need to know, connects seamlessly to Apple Watch, iPad, iPhone, COROS, Polar H10. 
The bike itself is as smooth as glass and extremely quiet no matter how hard you’re working. 
If you’re on the fence of whether or not to buy… get off the fence and order one, you won’t be sorry.
reviews.title: Great indoor training experience

groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content:
Worth every penny. Ride is smooth, power output is consistent and the transition between gears is so smooth and easy it has taken my racing to a new level.

It did take a few weeks to tweak the fit to be fully comfortable, but once I finally got it right there is no looking back.

I decided to invest as I do 98% of my riding indoors and I was tired of taking my bike and direct drive trainer to the bike shop for maintenance and troubleshooting when things were not right.

I've had the bike for about 6 weeks now and so far so great!
reviews.title: 6 weeks in - worth every penny

groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content:
The Kickr bike is a well engineered bike simulator. It was easy to set up and get going with Zwift workouts. Super stable and capable. Riding experience is smooth and I like the full integration with Zwift. I’m 70 years old and my preferred fit puts the top of the handlebar pretty level with the top of the saddle. To match my set up of the size 54 Specialized Diverge, I had to swap out the Kickr stem with a shorter one with a steeper angle. This could also be achieved with the stock stem by running the bike at a 3% or so incline. But using the incline to get the dimensions is incompatible with Zwift controlling the incline. My recommendation would be for wahoo to add the ability to move the zero incline setting via the software thus expanding the range of set up dimensions. An adjustable zero point for incline. Maybe this is available but I didn’t see it anywhere in the app. 

I am very happy with my purchase and would absolutely recommend this machine as a “close to real as possible” trainer.
reviews.title: Great but one issue

reviews.content:
This may be long so, overall, I recommend this product and am happy with it and with Wahoo.
Having said this, there were some disappointments. 
Bike feel is closer to an exercise bike than a real bike. Maybe my expectation were too high. Shifting feel is unnatural because of a braking effect when up-shifting. One must overcome this and it's very different than upshifting on a real bike. Though I can set the gear ratios to match my real bike, the feel is completely different and thus makes that feature of limited use. But by changing the gear ratio, I can mimic the feel I expect on a particular gradient (some of this will be app-dependent). Purchasing the bike is just the start of a large investment in apps, fans, electronic connections and accessories, so for those on a budget (like me), just be ware of this.
Things I like. Despite the lack or realism I expected, the overall experience of using the bike with an app that takes me to new places virtually, and that mimics gradients well, allows me to enjoy indoor cycling. I can train more days each week, and do so on days when I cannot or don't want to ride outside. Though some say that the gradient changing ability of the bike is over-rated, I quite like it. Also, I even like the stock seat that comes with the bike. I've had a few interactions with customer service about their app, and always received prompt and courteous replies. Finally, after riding this bike a couple of weeks, I noticed that my outdoor riding did improve. So the correlation works in that respect. I'm still new to the bike and haven't tapped its full potential, so these are just first impressions.
reviews.title: Good product which is a nice addition to my cycling options

groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content:
I read the other reviews & was a bit worried about getting a dodgy Wahoo Bike. But I based my decision on the fact that Wahoo have always been great and the fact that people who have a bad experience are more likely to write a bad review.

First things first, now I have a working bike, I love it. It’s an absolute treat and if it continues to do the job, I’ll be happy.

There is a big however. The 1st unit I received was faulty almost straight out the box. It didn’t switch on immediately but then it eventually worked.

On my 1st ride, I was struggling in a Zwift group ride with my HR suggesting I was about 0.7w.g above what my power was telling me. I was considering doing a validation exercise with my power pedals, but then the bike never switched on again.

The staff at Wahoo are super helpful and arranged a new bike to be sent to me. Unfortunately, the couriers were rubbish, appeared unable to answer my questions in my emails and it took nearly a week to arrive after Wahoo had despatched. It was meant to come on the Monday, then Wednesday and eventually the Friday. This was a pain because I was arranging my work schedule round it.

Of course, Wahoo don’t want poor reviews and my guess is returns are costly (& presumably costed in to the high cost of the bike). But I would hope that being a bit more robust in quality assurance after refurbishment would be better.

In the end I’m happy, but it took a bit of time to get there.
reviews.title: Great bike……eventually.

syndicationData.productName: Certified Reconditioned - KICKR BIKE v1

groupingData.productName: Certified Reconditioned - KICKR BIKE v1

reviews.content:
While the listing mentioned the possibility of blemishes, I was disappointed to find paint chips on such a nice bike.

The handlebar and seat post are poorly designed, leading to a well-documented slipping issue, which I confirmed through online research after experiencing it myself.

Wahoo should include some form of shim for the posts and consider using a nut and bolt for fixing, as they are clearly aware of this issue.

Having to remove the handlebars, apply grease, and tighten them overnight on the very first day was a terrible experience.

During a 1.5-hour workout, the handlebar repeatedly slipped, moving from 5.5cm to 3cm.

On the second day, the handlebar shifters failed. Support was excellent and promptly sent a replacement set.

These issues significantly detracted from my experience with the bike. It's unfortunate that the bike's quality doesn't match the support team's efforts. I am not confident that this bike will last beyond the two-year warranty period.
reviews.title: Great Concept, poor design choices.

syndicationData.productName: Certified Reconditioned - KICKR BIKE v1

groupingData.productName: Certified Reconditioned - KICKR BIKE v1

reviews.content: The handle bars are too narrow at the upright grip. The handlebar tape is not padded. The stack is too short, I'm 6' with an inseam of 34. I love how it can be programed to match your IRL bike in the chainring, cassette and shifters. All of the fit adjustments are great except for the stack. The seat is terrible, plan on getting a new seat.No peddles provided but that's not a big deal, you need to use your clipless anyway. Syncs seamlessly to Zwift, I haven't tried other training apps with it yet. I'm still trying to get used to it but so far it work fine. I own a Kickr Snap and a Kickr Core. I just got tired of bike on-bike off in the shoulder seansons.
reviews.title: Great trainer do far.
